urls.title: Interim public health considerations for COVID-19 vaccination of adolescents in the EU/EEA
urls.description: This technical report provides a set of interim public health considerations to support EU/EEA public health authorities taking decisions on the administration of COVID-19 vaccines to adolescents (12- to 18-year-olds).

RT @LivePOLITICO: Andrea Ammon director @ECDC_EU shares her assessment on #PCR tests. Check out below | Watch live the discussion on our we‚Ä¶

Andrea #Ammon:
The difficulty with assessing which variant could be of concern is that there are still issues with sequencing capacity. An assessment needs to be done based on sequencing carried on a sample of proper size.

#COVID19 #SavingSummer https://t.co/0mCCYhYWAv

#ECDC Director Andrea #Ammon:

We are monitoring the global sequencing of #SARSCov2 virus variants on a daily basis. Especially so for the variants proving to have increased transmissibility or possibility to escape our immunity.

#COVID19 #SavingSummer #VoC #VoI https://t.co/KSvUfECO44

#ECDC Dir. Andrea #Ammon:
It does not matter whether the #PCR test was negative 24 or 72h before travel. What is important from epidemiological point of view is how the person behaved and whether there was a risk of #SARSCoV2 infection between the test and boarding.
#SavingSummer https://t.co/LFBbLniIIU

Andrea #Ammon on #SARSCoV2 variants:
The risk they pose depends on the characteristics ‚Äì some have higher transmissibility combined with disease severity, the ones worrying most have an ability to escape some of our immunity and this we need to monitor very closely.
#SavingSummer https://t.co/mNCPvmMprI

#ECDC Director Andrea #Ammon:
A recent #COVID19 infection and full vaccination provides protection from #SARSCov2 infection on different levels ‚Äì as seen from accumulated evidence. There are still some risk of transmission.

#SavingSummer https://t.co/digpMHHiCe

The reclassification was done after new information became available on increased transmissibility and some impact on vaccine effectiveness, especially after one vaccine dose.

You can read more on the #VoC in our Threat Assessment Brief: https://t.co/t3nZQ9pKby
#COVID19

We have recently reclassified the #SARSCoV2 virus variant - B.1.617.2 (detected in India) from a Variant of Interest to a Variant of Concern - #VoC.

text: RT @Animals_EFSA: Another interesting project in collaboration with EFSA! #ECDC #EFSA about #WNV and #USUV infections in humans and #animal‚Ä¶
@MBehpour @CREWcrew @MeidasTouch @funder @RichardEngel @PeterHotez <3

Why is being able to differentiate species so important?

To make sure the surveillance of mosquito-borne diseases like #malaria, #dengue or #WestNileFever is on track!

More on mosquito-borne diseases here: https://t.co/nRN0ASXsYY

Check the tool here: https://t.co/xy0AHdEuTP
Our key provides the non-specialist with reference material to help recognise an invasive mosquito species, displaying 6 invasive and 9 native species present in the EU/EEA. https://t.co/9iDjLDkZf7

There are many taxonomic keys available for identifying #mosquitoes of medical and veterinary importance, but they are almost all designed for professionally trained #entomologists. https://t.co/J7TZ52yRC5
More people are getting involved in the surveillance of invasive #mosquito species in the EU/EEA, not just professionals with formal training in #entomology. https://t.co/UtjWXUM2W9

How to recognise invasive #mosquito species? What for?

We have just launched a new tool - for specialists in the field and those who are not specialists yet.

Take a look at our "Reverse identification key for invasive mosquito species" here: https://t.co/xy0AHdEuTP https://t.co/w0dcQuPrBJ

To be effective, #HandHygiene should be performed: at 5 specific moments:

1. before touching a patient
2. before a clean/aseptic procedure
3. after body fluid exposure risk
4. after touching a patient
5. after touching a patient‚Äôs surroundings.

#WorldHandHygieneDay2021 https://t.co/tZnkolgjSp

The point of care refers to the place where three elements come together:
1. the patient
2. the healthcare worker
3. care or treatment involving contact with the patient or their surroundings. https://t.co/HjfF1MeP7A

Healthcare-associated infections, including those resistant to antibiotics, are a growing public health problem in Europe.

This year we call on #healthcare workers to achieve effective hand hygiene at the #PointOfCare. 

#WorldHandHygieneDay #Worldhandhygieneday2021 @WHO https://t.co/TKnWnTJcLb

In the context of the #COVID19 pandemic, #HandHygiene also is one of the most effective ways of reducing the spread of #SARSCoV2.

And here we talk not only about #HandHygiene in the healthcare settings, but in most common life situations too! https://t.co/zgG1sf2hXA

#HandHygiene is the most important measure to prevent the transmission of pathogens in healthcare settings, and as one of the main components of infection & control practices with prudent use of antibiotics, contributes to tackling the threat of #AMR.

https://t.co/d1uWnxl4ir

Healthcare-associated infections, including those resistant to antibiotics, are a growing public health problem in Europe.

However, a large % of these infections are preventable by improving hand hygiene practices.

Every 5 May, the ‚ÄúSAVE LIVES: Clean Your Hands‚Äù campaign takes place as part of a major global effort led by @WHO to mobilise people to increase adherence to #HandHygiene in all healthcare settings - protecting #Healthcare workers & patients from healthcare-associated infections. https://t.co/oB1Dr4Y44i

Seconds save lives: clean your hands!
That's the message we want to shout out loud, especially today on World #HandHygiene Day!

Along with the @WHO, we call on healthcare workers to achieve effective hand hygiene at the point of care.

Wash your hands - prevent diseases! https://t.co/oUVzCY08Jx
